page.title: 06THE COYPU NUISANCE
page.content: The coypu is an introduced species,having escaped from fur farms. It quickly established itself in the wild and is now found in much of Broadland.The coypu could not be descibed as beautiful, resembling a huge rat with orange teeth,but its behaviour is interesting and antics somewhat endearing.It has however caused severe erosion to river banks because of its nesting habit and must be controlled for this reason.An unusual local sight is the 'coypu control' van with trapping baskets fixed to its roof.
